    • Method Detail

      • getDefaultLogConfigFile

        public static InputStream getDefaultLogConfigFile()
        Retrieves default logging properties file from this package as InputStream.
        Called by getLogConfigFile(int, String) if no file passed to it or file not found.
        Returns:
        InputStream of logging configuration using logging.properties in org.openntf.domino.logging
        Since:
        org.openntf.domino 1.0.0

      • getLogConfigFile

        public static InputStream getLogConfigFile(int fileType,
                                           String filePath)
        Retrieves a log file or, if that cannot be retrieved, the default log file.
        Parameters:
        fileType - int passed to switch statement in DominoUtils.getDominoProps.
        See DominoUtils.getDominoProps for options available.
        filePath - String path of file to be used. Can be literal or relative to directory
        Returns:
        InputStream content of properties file
        Since:
        org.openntf.domino 1.0.0

      • dateToString

        public static String dateToString(Date value,
                                  boolean utc)
        Converts a date to an ISO8601 string.
        Parameters:
        value - The date.
        utc - Boolean, whether to format the time in UTC or the local time zone.
        Returns:
        The ISO8601 string.
        Since:
        org.openntf.domino 1.0.0

      • loadLoggerConfig

        public static void loadLoggerConfig(boolean relative,
                                    String filePath)
        Initialise a logger based on a configuration file.
        Parameters:
        relative - boolean whether filepath is relative to folder
        filePath - String of filepath for logging properties file, or empty string to load the default org.openntf.domino logger
        Since:
        org.openntf.domino 1.0.0

      • setupLoggerEx

        public static boolean setupLoggerEx(String logName,
                                    ArrayList<Handler> handlers,
                                    boolean useParentHandler,
                                    Level newSeverityLevel)
        Updates a specified Logger with settings passed in. Pass in an ArrayList of Handlers, whether or not to use the parent handler, and a new security level. Options for security level are:
        • Level.SEVERE
        • Level.WARNING
        • Level.INFO
        • Level.CONFIG
        • Level.FINE
        • Level.FINER
        • Level.FINEST
        Parameters:
        logName - The name of the logger to modify
        handlers - an array of Handler objects to apply to the logger. Any pre-defined handlers will be removed. To pass in existing handlers, just use myLogger.getHandlers().
        useParentHandler - boolean of whether or not to use parent handlers
        newSeverityLevel - the new severity level
        Returns:
        success or failure in updating the logger
        Since:
        org.openntf.domino 1.0.0

      • hasAccessException

        public static boolean hasAccessException(Logger log_)
        Check whether you can change a logger property. XPages and Websphere security is draconian and doesn't allow modifying loggers. One option is set java.policy to grant all, but that's not good. This will see whether they work or not.

        In case of failure, you can either use another, non-standard logging mechanism like OpenLog, or log using com.ibm.xsp.domino and Level.SEVERE - that's the only level logged by that logger.
        Parameters:
        log_ - Logger to try and change
        Returns:
        success or failure.
        Since:
        org.openntf.domino 1.0.0

      • getLogger

        public static Logger getLogger(String logName)
        Gets a logger from the LogManager.
        Parameters:
        logName - name of the logger
        Returns:
        The Logger object
        Since:
        org.openntf.domino 1.0.0
